intro: Cheiranthus pacificus, commonly known as the Pacific wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces showy, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in the spring and summer. It has linear, grass-like leaves and thrives in sandy or rocky soils along coastal areas. Cheiranthus pacificus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
